Catalan[edit]

Etymology[edit]

(This etymology is missing. Please add to it, or discuss it at the Etymology scriptorium.)

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Balearic, Central, Valencian) IPA(key): /ˈblaw/
  • Rhymes: -aw

Adjective[edit]

blau (feminine blava, masculine plural blaus, feminine plural blaves)

  1. blue

Noun[edit]

blau m (plural blaus)

  1. blue
  2. bruise

Related terms[edit]

  • blauet
  • blaugrana
  • blaüra
  • blaürar
  • blava
  • blavar
  • blavenc
  • blavenca
  • blaverol
  • blavet
  • blaveta
  • blavís
  • blavor
  • blavós
  • blavosenc
  • blavura

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German blā, blāwes, from Old High German blāo, from Proto-Germanic *blēwaz.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /blaʊ̯/
  • Rhymes: -aʊ
  • audio (Germany)
    		(file)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)

Adjective[edit]

blau (comparative blauer, superlative am blausten or am blauesten)

  1. blue
  2. drunk

Hunsrik[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • plau (Wiesemann spelling system)

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German blā, blāwes, from Old High German blāo, from Proto-Germanic *blēwaz.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /plaʊ̯/

Adjective[edit]

blau (comparative blauer, superlative blauest)

  1. blue
    Blaue Aue.
    Blue eyes.

Declension[edit]

Declension of blau
masculinefeminineneuterplural
Weak inflectionnominativeblaublaublaublaue
accusativeblaueblaublaublaue
dativeblaueblaueblaueblaue
Strong inflectionnominativeblauerblaueblauesblaue
accusativeblaueblaueblauesblaue
dativeblauemblauerblauemblaue

blau

  1. blue

Middle Dutch[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Old Dutch *blāo, from Proto-Germanic *blēwaz.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /blaːu/, /blau/

Adjective[edit]

blau

  1. blue

Inflection[edit]

This adjective needs an inflection-table template.

Alternative forms[edit]

  • blâ
  • blâeu

Descendants[edit]

  • Dutch: blauw, blaauw
    • Afrikaans: blou
  • Limburgish: blów

Noun[edit]

blau n

  1. the colour blue

Inflection[edit]

This noun needs an inflection-table template.

Alternative forms[edit]

  • blâeu

Romansch[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • (Sutsilvan, Surmiran) blo
  • (Puter) blov

Etymology[edit]

From a Germanic language, from Proto-Germanic *blēwaz.

Adjective[edit]

blau m (feminine singular blaua, masculine plural blaus, feminine plural blauas)

  1. (Rumantsch Grischun, Sursilvan, Sutsilvan, Vallader) blue
